p: The first study with this purpose was carried out with Mesosphaerum pectinatum (syn. Hyptis pectinata) using the writhing test. The oral administration of leaves extracts (hexane, chloroform and ethyl acetate) (100, 200, 400Â mg/kg of body weight in mice) significantly reduced the number of writhing induced by acetic acid and increased the response to thermal stimuli in hot-plate test ( Lisboa et al., 2006). In the same year, oleanoic acid ( 68), isolated from Eriope blanchetii, showed capability to inhibit capsaicin evoked acute nociception due to mechanisms possibly involving opioid receptors, nitric oxide, and K + ATP channels ( Maia et al., 2006).
